  1-10-1B2a(7) for Budget Officer acting as City Collector.
1-9A-2: DUTIES:
Duties: The City Collector shall perform those duties enumerated in Illinois
Revised Statutes, chapter 24, paragraphs 3-11-25, 3-11-26 and 3-11-27 and such
other duties and functions as may be required by statute or ordinance or, from
time to time, directed by the City Council. (1992 Code)
1-9A-3: SALARY:
The City Collector shall receive such annual salary as may be fixed in the City
budget by the City Council, payable bi-weekly. (1992 Code)
ARTICLE B. LEGAL ADVISORS
SECTION:
1-9B-1: City Attorney
1-9B-2: City Prosecutor
1-9B-1: CITY ATTORNEY:
   A.   Office Created; Appointment: There is hereby created the office of City
Attorney, an executive office of the City. The City Attorney shall be appointed
by the Mayor, with the advice and consent of the City Council. (1976 Code §
2-7-1; 1992 Code)
   B.   Duties: The City Attorney shall:
      1.   Legal Advisor of City: Be the legal advisor of the City and shall
tender advice on all legal questions affecting the City whenever requested to
do so by any City official. Upon request by the Mayor or by the City Council,
he shall reduce any such opinion to writing. (1976 Code §2-7-5)
      2.   Judgments: See to the full enforcement of all judgments or decrees
rendered or entered in favor of the City and of all similar interlocutory
orders. (1976 Code §
2-7-4)
      3.   Draft Documents: Except as may be otherwise directed by the City
Council, draft or supervise the drafting of any contract, lease or other
document or instrument to which the City may be a party. Upon request by the
City Council, he shall draft ordinances covering any subject within the power
of the City. (1976 Code §2-7-6)
      4.   Suits and Actions: Prosecute or defend any and all suits or actions
at law or equity to which the City may be a party or in which it may be
interested or which may be brought against or by any officer of the City on
behalf of the City or in the capacity of such persons as an officer of the
City. He shall be paid on an hourly fee basis in addition to his annual salary
or as provided by contract for services performed in prosecuting or defending
any suits or actions at law or in equity. Appointment of a City Attorney shall
not prevent the City from engaging the services of additional counsel. (1976
Code §
2-7-3; 1992 Code)
1-9B-2:CITY PROSECUTOR:
   A.   Office Created; Appointment: There is hereby created the office of City
Prosecutor, an executive office of the City. The City Prosecutor shall be
appointed by the Mayor, with advice and consent of the City Council. (1976 Code
§
2-7-2; 1992 Code)
   B.   Duties: The City Prosecutor shall prosecute all ordinance violations
and such traffic violations as may be delegated to him.
   C.   Salary: The City Prosecutor shall be paid a monthly fee as set by
ordinance from time to time. (1976 Code §
2-7-3; 1992 Code)
ARTICLE C. DEPARTMENTS OF PUBLIC WORKS AND BUILDING AND INSPECTIONAL SERVICES
SECTION:
1-9C-1: Creation Of Departments
1-9C-2: Offices Established; Appointment
1-9C-3: Superintendent Of Public Works
1-9C-4: Chief Building Official
1-9C-1: CREATION OF DEPARTMENTS:
The Department of Public Works and the Department of Building and Inspectional
Services are hereby established. (Ord. O-36-97, 8-18-1997, eff. 12-1-1997)
1-9C-2: OFFICES ESTABLISHED; APPOINTMENT:
The exempt offices of Chief Building Official, Superintendent of Public Works,
and Deputy Superintendent of Public Works and Director of Operations are hereby
established. These officers shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice and
consent of the City Council. The salaries of these positions shall be
established by the budget or other ordinance. The Superintendent of Public
Works shall be responsible for the general management and administration of the
Department of Public Works. The Deputy Superintendent of Public Works shall be
subordinance to the Superintendent of Public Works and shall have such
responsibilities as are assigned by the Superintendent of Public Works. The
Director of Operations shall be responsible for supervising the daily
operations of the Department of Public Works and shall perform such other
duties as are assigned by the Superintendent of Public Works. The Chief
Building Official shall be responsible for the general management of the
Department of Building and inspectional Services. (Ord. O-36-97, 8-18-1997,
eff. 12-1-1997; amd. Ord. O-01-2024, 3-4-2024)
1-9C-3: SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC WORKS:
   A.   Duties: The duties of the Superintendent of Public Works shall include,
but shall not be limited to, the following:
      1.   Director Of Water Works System: The Superintendent of Public Works
shall be Director of the Water Works System and shall have charge of the
operation thereof.
      2.   Sewers And Drains: All sewers and drains in any public street or
other place belonging to the City shall be under the care of the Superintendent
of Public Works, who shall be charged with the repair and operation of the
same.
      3.   Maintenance And Repair Of Public Ways And Property: The
Superintendent of Public Works shall have charge of the repair, care and
maintenance of all public streets, alleys, sidewalks, parks and other public
places in the City.
      4.   Custodian Of Public Property: All public property not assigned by
ordinance to some other officer shall be in the custody of the Superintendent
of Public Works, and he/she shall have charge of the care, maintenance and
repair of such property and buildings. (Ord. O-36-97, 8-18-1997, eff. 12-1-
1997)
1-9C-4: CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL:
   A.   Duties: The duties of the Chief Building Official shall include, but
not be limited to, the following:
      1.   The Chief Building Official shall act as conservator of the peace
with police powers for the purposes of enforcing the provisions of this Code
relating to the licensing and regulation of businesses and occupations and
health, sanitation and safety.
      2.   The Chief Building Official shall be the enforcing officer of the
following Titles of this Code:
Title 3, Business and License Regulations
Title 4, Public Health and Safety
Title 7, Public Ways and Property
Title 8, Building Regulations
Title 11, Land Subdivisions
Title 12, Flood Control
The Chief Building Official shall take all necessary and appropriate action to
compel compliance with all such ordinances and regulations. (Ord. O-36-97, 8-
18-1997, eff. 12-1-1997)

ARTICLE E. PERSONNEL POLICY
